reactiveLiquidity.description: Actions automate your liquidity to where it is needed.

feeShare.description: Capture fees from Actions and strategies.

keepers.description: Become a Keeper to receive rewards for triggering Actions.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Mero liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

earn.description: Earn compounded yield from strategy profits and protocol fees.

stake.description: Stake your pool LP tokens to receive Mero rewards.

claim.description: Unstake your LP tokens or claim your Mero rewards at any time.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Mero liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

register.description: Register Compound or Aave v2 loans on-chain to receive collateral top-ups.

protect.description: Earn compounded yield and protocol fees while keepers monitor your loan and transfer your capital to avoid liquidation.

claim.description: Unregister or update a position, withdraw LP tokens or claim Mero rewards at any time.

uniswap.description: Mero Keepers detect when the price has moved outside of your defined range and move the liquidity into Meroâ€™s yield pools. Once the price is back within range, Keepers move your liquidity back into Uniswap.

limitOrders.description: Once a limit order can be filled, a Keeper can withdraw the required funds from yield pools and execute the trade on the AMM.

curveImbalance.description: Keepers can detect when LP pools become imbalanaced and remove liquidity for you on your behalf - saving you from substantial losses.

nfts.description: Create a limit order for an NFT with a specific set of rarity traits. Once the price drops within your desired amount, a purchase Action is executed and liquidity is removed from Meroâ€™s yield pools.

propose.description: Actions can be added through the Mero DAO. Join the Mero community and propose a new action!

getStarted.description: Deposit liquidity and start earning yield.

notFound.subHeader: Try one of the handy links below - or <0>get in touch</0> if you believe there is an issue.

introduction.paragraph1: <0>Mero</0> is a trustless and interest generating protocol that automates asset efficiency through yield aggregation and customizable liquidity delegation. The Mero protocolâ€™s reactive liquidity pools empower DeFi users through the realization of greater asset utility, efficient aggregation of yield, and mitigation of opportunity cost.

capitalEfficiency.paragraph1: In the traditional finance (TradFi) world capital efficiency is the ratio of how much a company is spending on growing revenue and how much they are getting in return. Something that requires low capital but generates high returns is considered to be highly capital efficient.
capitalEfficiency.paragraph2: In DeFi capital efficiency has become somewhat of an ironic term. The term is often overused and while DeFi claims to be capital efficient, it often isnâ€™t.

notEfficient.paragraph1: DeFi protocols today generally focus on fulfilling one specific function. This may include borrowing and lending, market orders, yield aggregation, etc. While many protocols fulfill specific needs in a capital efficient way, the broader DeFi ecosystem is left inefficient.
notEfficient.paragraph2: This is because DeFi today is bounded by static or single-utility liquidity pools. Meaning, liquidity must be dedicated to only serving one function at a time. Every time a user deposits assets into a protocol they realize the opportunity cost of not having their assets allocated elsewhere. This is one of the reasons why yield aggregating protocols do not capture more Total Value Locked (TVL). Every dollar increase in provided liquidity results in an increased realized opportunity cost.
notEfficient.paragraph3: Individuals often make the argument that if your assets are not earning yield you are losing money. While this statement might be true if the alternative is holding cash in a TradFi savings account, it is a fallacy when applied to DeFi. Deploying your assets to a yield farming protocol might actually result in a loss when compared to market returns. The correct argument is that if your assets are not earning yield at the right time you are losing money.

earnYield.header: Earning yield at the right time
earnYield.paragraph1: Generally the correct time to deploy your assets to earn yield is during periods of high volatility (trading fees) or high demand for leverage (lending rates). However, there is no generic or universal formula for when to provide liquidity in a yield farming protocol. This is because every DeFi user has their own unique strategy which comes with specific needs.
earnYield.paragraph2: To this date, DeFi users have had to manually shift their liquidity between earning yield and other positions in order to stay efficient. This has placed somewhat of an efficiency ceiling on DeFi users. The rapidly evolving and highly volatile nature of crypto makes maintaining capital efficiency through manually delegating liquidity virtually impossible.

reactiveLiquidity.paragraph1: Mero eliminates this aforementioned capital inefficiency through the deployment of novel multi-utility liquidity pools. Until now, yield farming protocols have focused on solving opportunity cost by trying to increase yield. However yield is not a solution to opportunity cost, it is compensation.
reactiveLiquidity.paragraph2: Mero effectively mitigates opportunity cost and thus increases capital efficiency by changing the nature or utility of provided liquidity itself. Unlike normal yield-farming protocols, where provided liquidity will remain static until the user withdraws it, liquidity deposited into Mero can autonomously react to market conditions or user defined variables. Specifically, users can add customizable actions to their provided liquidity. Adding an action allows users to earn yield until their assets are more efficient elsewhere. At which point, the Mero protocol will automatically delegate your liquidity to where it is needed.
reactiveLiquidity.paragraph3: Mero generates yield from both yield-farming strategies and actions. Every time an action occurs on Mero, a small action fee is charged and paid out to Mero liquidity providers. It is important to note that registering an action to your Mero liquidity is optional. Actions are solely an additional utility layer, empowering liquidity providers to do more with their deposits. Because Mero is able to capture yield beyond strategy profits, it can be an optimal option for users only looking to farm yield and not to make their liquidity reactive.

action.paragraph1: The first action that Mero will support, which will be available at launch, is collateral top ups. Support for more actions will be added in the future. The core protocol architecture of Mero is designed in a way that makes adding new actions, strategies, or supported protocols (for actions) easy. This allows Mero to perpetually increase yield and utility for LPs as DeFi evolves.

what.paragraph1: A top-up is the act of depositing additional collateral in order to increase the health factor of your loan or mitigate liquidation risk. Mero liquidity providers can use their Mero LP tokens to register Collateral Top-up Positions. This creates back up collateral or what you could call interest earning liquidation protection. When a user registers a Collateral Top-up Position they must specify how much of their Mero liquidity should be shifted and at what health factor a top-up should occur. After registering a Collateral Top-up Position the Mero userâ€™s liquidity will continue to be allocated to yield-farming strategies until it is needed.
what.paragraph2: Meroâ€™s Collateral Top-up Position increase collateral efficiency by enabling any borrower on supported protocols (Mero will support Aave v2 & Compound loans at launch) to earn yield with their collateral. Furthermore this also enables borrowers to increase leverage by depositing less collateral and hedge liquidation risk by automatically posting extra collateral when needed.
what.paragraph3: Mero creates an infrastructure that enables the combination of on-chain actions, off-chain keepers that react to market events, and yield-farming. This unique combination lends itself to a multitude of actions and integration with many protocols. Mero not only makes liquidity more efficient, but also makes other protocols safer and smarter.

fees.paragraph1: The protocol architecture that facilitates Meroâ€™s reactive liquidity creates the framework for a fee generating powerhouse. The Mero protocols platform fees can be broken up into two main categories (actions and strategies).

action.paragraph1: Every time an action is executed, a fee is collected in the form of LP tokens. Part of that fee is sent directly to liquidity providers which in turn compounds yield, while a portion is paid to the keeper that executes an action. Action fees create yield diversified from traditional strategies. For example, Mero collateral top up fees will generate higher returns during periods of market volatility (because more loans will need to be topped up).

strategies.paragraph1: A performance fee is charged on profits harvested by strategies. A share of this performance fee is paid to the strategist of the yield-farming strategy employed, while a small part of the fee is kept in a poolâ€™s reserve fund.

token.paragraph1: The Mero governance token distribution is designed to incentive participation among three core protocol stakeholders (liquidity providers, AMM liquidity providers, and Keepers). The majority of the token supply will be distributed to these stakeholders. More information regarding Mero tokenecomics can be found in the <0>docs</0>.
token.paragraph2: The Mero governance token is the native ERC-20 token of the Mero protocol. Token holders can lock their tokens to participate in protocol governance. Additionally, locked Mero governance tokens receive a share of the protocol fees or revenue. This share of protocol fees or revenue will be determined by the locking period that the Mero governance token holder selects.
token.paragraph3: Protocol governance will be executed on-chain and can include (but is not limited to):

community.paragraph1: The Mero protocol will ultimately (through the launch of the Mero DAO) be controlled by the community. Meroâ€™s reactive liquidity creates unique opportunities for community contributions that do not involve on-chain governance.
community.paragraph2: Contributions can include (but are not limited to):
community.paragraph3: If you are interested in becoming a Mero contributor, chat with us in our contributions <0>discord channel</0>!

pools.overview: Meroâ€™s single-asset pools aggregate yield across strategies. Add utility and autonomy to your liquidity with actions.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of total assets held in Mero liquidity pools (Total Value Locked)

apy.tooltip: The average annual percent yield over a 30 day period

revenue.tooltip: The total value of fees generated by the Mero protocol

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in Mero liquidity pools

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets that are allocated to Actions. Assets allocated to Actions still earn yield

rewards.tooltip: The current value of earned rewards that have yet to be claimed

pool.overview: Deposit {{asset}} to begin earning yield via the {{strategy}} strategy. Once you have deposited, you can make your liquidity reactive by creating an action.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of assets held in the pool (Total Value Locked)

apy.tooltip: The current annual percent yield earned by pool LPs. This is the average APY over the past 60 days

lp.tooltip: The current exchange rate of {{lpToken}} to {{underlying}}. {{underlying}}={{lpToken}}*{{exchangeRate}}

strategy.tooltip: Deposits into this pool are allocated to the 3CRV yield farming strategy. Strategy profits are subject to a performance fee of 0%. This fee is already deducted from the APR displayed.

withdrawalFees.tooltip: Withdrawal fees start at {{max}} and decrease linearly over time until they reach {{min}}. This takes {{days}} days

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in the pool

earned.tooltip: The amount of the asset you have earned over the lifetime of the pool

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets that are allocated to Actions. Assets allocated to Actions still earn yield

actions.overview: Use this screen to monitor your Actions. Actions are a set of predefined market triggers, that when occur, something is done on your behalf.

topup.header: I have found a protectable loan!

gasBank.topupAmountTooltip: The amount of ETH send to the Gas Bank to cover the gas cost of executing the transactions. Unspend ETH will be refunded to your wallet.

debtRepayment.description: Repay borrowed assets when close to liquidation

pool.header: Select the pool you want the debt repayment to come from:
pool.noDepositsHeader: To register an action you must deposit assets into a Mero pool
pool.subHeader: Liquidity deposited into a Mero pool can be earmarked for debt repayment. You will earn yield while your liquidity is in a Mero pool.
pool.noDebt: You don't have any debt on this loan in {{asset}}

deposit.header: Enter an amount of {{asset}} to deposit
deposit.subHeader: This {{asset}} can be used for debt repayment if triggered by user defined conditions.

conditions.subHeader: Define the specific market triggers that determine when a Debt Repayment will activate.

confirmation.summaryEnd: drops below {{threshold}}, {{single}} {{asset}} ({{singleUsd}}) will be repaid on the loan. This will be repeated each time the collateralization ratio drops below {{threshold}}, until a total of {{max}} {{asset}} ({{maxUsd}}) is repaid.

tooltip.header: When an Action is triggered a small fee is paid to Mero LPs, Keepers and MERO stakers.

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: The lending protocol on which the user is borrowing funds (currently compatible with Aave v2 and Compound)

address.label: Address
address.tooltip: The address of the owner of the position to repay debt (e.g. if Alice is the borrower on Aave v2 that should be repaid then this would be Aliceâ€™s address)

threshold.label: Threshold
threshold.question: What health factor do you want the debt repayment Action to trigger at?
threshold.tooltip: The health factor threshold a debt repayment should occur at

single.label: Single repayment
single.question: How much would you like to repay per debt repayment?
single.tooltip: Amount of a single debt repayment increment (e.g. debt repayment increments of 2,500 DAI)

max.label: Max repayment
max.question: What would you like the total debt repayment amount to be?
max.tooltip: Maximum debt repayment amount (value of your liquidity allocated for debt repayments)

priority.label: Priority fee
priority.question: What priority fee should be used for your debt repayment?
priority.tooltip: An additional fee paid to Ethereum miners to prioritise your transaction and have it completed quicker. 3 Gwei is a suitable amount.

gas.label: Max gas price
gas.question: What is the maximum gas price to pay per debt repayment?
gas.tooltip: The maximum gas price used when paying for each debt repayment. Value is in Gwei units. If value is too low, then your debt repayment may not execute in time which could result in liquidation. A value of at least 200 Gwei is recommended.

stake.description: Stake MERO and earn a share in x% of platform revenue, paid out in meroDAI tokens.

mero.overview: Stake MERO to earn a share of platform fees and gain voting weight - which can be used to vote to determine which pools receive MERO inflation.

apr.description: Stake for 12 months to achieve max boost

earnings.label: Estimated daily earnings

confirmation.description: You are about to stake {{ammount}} MERO. You will immediately begin earning platform fees, it will take 12 months to reach maximum boost (5x). Unstaking MERO takes two months, during this period you will continue to earn platform fees and can continue to vote.

confirmation.description: You are about to stake {{meroAmount}} MERO. It will take {{monthsRemaining}} months to reach maximum boost (5x) but you will immediately begin earning platform fees and gain the ability to vote in the MERO inflation.

liveHelp.disclaimer: Note: this is not financial advice.

thresholdLow.text: I noticed you have entered a threshold of {{threshold}}. This is very close to liquidation and in times of market volatility I suggest at least {{recommendedThreshold}} or more.

thresholdHigh.text: This will trigger immediately because the health factor you have entered exceeds the current health factor of the loan. I suggest you decrease the Health Factor to {{recommendedThreshold}}.

singleLow.text: Your max gas cost is {{maxGas}} ({{ethAmount}} ETH), however the single amount is only {{single}} ({{underlyingAmount}} {{underlyingSymbol}}). I recommend increasing the single amount to {{suggestion}} {{underlyingSymbol}} for more efficient actions.

topupPositionLow.text: Iâ€™ve noticed your {{protocol}} Action is running low on funds. I suggest you delete that Action and register a new one as soon as possible.
